summary: I just rewatched Iron Man 3 so i’m back on my bullshit. So we’ve all read the classic Peter Parker on a field trip to SI right....
body: I just rewatched Iron Man 3 so i’m back on my bullshit. So we’ve all read the classic Peter Parker on a field trip to SI right. but imagine Harley Keener being on a field trip to New York with his class and going to Stark Tower is the main event. And Peter Parker is the reluctant tour guide, put on the duty for blowing up in the lab or something. Harley realizes who he is and decides to mess with him and asks weirdly specific questions during the tour (mostly about shit Peter’s done before and Tony has ranted to Harley about).

summary: Cast your mutuals as characters!
question: Cast your mutuals as characters!
answer:
@peterparkerdd She is my Peter Parker. She is always super kind and this aggressive bubbly ball of smol and memes. She is very “memelordish” and so is my boy Peter P. She is from what i can tell, a LITERAL GENIUS. Also she is a great lover of cursed images… which i can see Petey l o v i n g. And she is one of my closest friends in this site.

@twelve-percent-of-three-thousand She is my Captain America. She is an elderly woman (even though she is my age) who is afraid of cursed images. She also has a super strong sense of justice and will do everything in her power to help the little guy. She also is very kind and is always there for me. Also it is very ironic that she is Captain AMERICA because she is from the United Kingdom.

@that-one-sarcastic-weirdo Props for being like my only friend from the United States. I would say that they are my Iron Man. They are a bit frazzled about my health and are telling me to “hydrate or dyrate” which i say is bull because i’m immortal. They are also this sassy, funny, and hilarious person so there.

@a-book-locked-nerd She is my #uwu pal. I would say that she is Wanda however. She is very clever and confused about Americans work. And i love her for it. She has a strong mind and is very kind. She also is very adorable.

I love you all so much!!!

summary: Agent of Hydra || Peter Parker
title: Agent of Hydra || Peter Parker
body:
masterlist found here

pairing - Peter x Hydra!reader
word count - 2,283
warnings - I guess there’s a Season 1 Agent of SHIELD spoiler
A/N - this is for @blissfulparker‘s 5K Writing Challenge! | prompt:  “I wish it wasn’t you but it is, and I’m so sorry.” | I’m pretty proud of this but for some reason I feel like it won’t be very popular lol

summary - You’re not proud of your background and the reputation your last name gives you. When your first mission comes and it involves your best friend, you’re stuck between a rock and a hard place. Are you on the side of your dad, or the side of heroes?

As Shakespeare once wrote, “Some people are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.”

If that statement was true, then the reverse must also be true. Some people are born evil, some achieve evil, and some have evil thrust upon them.

You were a combination of the first and last.

Your dad was John Garret. Known under many aliases, including Deathlok and the Clairvoyant, he was a powerful member of Hydra. You were raised hearing his two twisted mottos:

First, You can’t ever get attached to anyone or anything. You have to fight that weakness inside you.

And second, Don’t trust anyone, ever. Especially me.

For most of your life, you just went along with it. Your dad was evil, so you felt like you were born evil. The evil was thrust upon you. You weren’t given a choice between one side or the other. Growing up, you didn’t know any better anyway. You agreed with the things your dad told you because it was the only thing you heard. Hydra was superior. SHIELD were the wrong ones. You had no reason to ever question him. For your whole life, you proudly hailed Hydra.

When you entered high school, things changed. You changed. You were more exposed to other opinions and so many good people who believed in good. Believed in SHIELD. Believed in heroes. At Midtown High, you became friends with Peter, Ned, and MJ. It made everything in your life so confusing. You started to question the exact principles you were raised on. Your friends stood for everything your dad was against. Everything you were raised to be against. Especially Peter. Peter was all about the Avengers. He spoke so earnestly about what they stood for that, soon enough, you started to believe in them too.

And then, you did the really stupid thing, and you fell in love with Peter. Peter who your dad would despise. Peter who worshiped SHIELD and stood for everything good. Peter who you knew was Spider-Man.

Peter, Peter, Peter.

Just like that, the first of your father’s mottos was ignored.

You can’t ever get attached to anyone or anything.

You loved your friends more than anything. You couldn’t imagine your teenage years without them. You were attached. If anything happened to them, you had no idea what you would do. That’s why you hated every mission that pinned Hydra against the Avengers. It put Peter in immediate danger, but you couldn’t say anything to anybody about it. You couldn’t warn Peter of Hydra’s plans, because it would make Peter see who you really were. That was an identity you were trying so hard to hide from him. But you couldn’t ask your dad to ease up on the heroes, because that would show your weakness. The weakness you were supposed to fight.

You were stuck between a rock and a hard place.

When you turned 16, your dad decided it was time for you to suit up and join the team. His team. Hydra. Your worst nightmare was coming true. Deep down, you always knew the day would come, but you had delusionally told yourself that it wouldn’t. You had to pretend you had been waiting for the day, when in reality you had been dreading it.

You had heard the stories of recruits from days’ past. You knew Grant Ward. You knew about his life and all of the events that lead up to his initiation. You knew the aftermath of his recruitment, how he dropped Fitz and Simmons -two respected agents of SHIELD- in the bottom of the ocean. You knew. You knew about it all. And you knew your dad expected you to turn out the same. He expected you to kill the things you were attached to. To get rid of your weaknesses.

But you couldn’t do it. You couldn’t do it, because you weren’t Ward. You weren’t evil. You couldn’t look your dog in the eyes and kill it. That was it. That was the initiation. Kill the thing you loved. So, when your dad left you in the middle of the woods with Sparky -the dog you grew up with- and a gun, you shot a bullet into the air and let your dog run free. What your dad didn’t know didn’t hurt.

Still, this meant you were Hydra now. You were a part of it all. A part of all the evil. The worst thing was not having any friends to confide in. The night of your initiation, you had to cry yourself to sleep with the guilt of being evil weighing on your chest. Alone.

The next day, you were in your first Hydra mission meeting. You sat around the table with people you knew by name from hearing endless praise from your dad. Your dad sat at the head, giving a rundown of the mission. With your intel at SHIELD, you knew all of the insider details. This also meant you knew that the Avengers were on a mission to destroy all of Hydra’s bases. In order to beat them to the punch, Hydra’s mission was to find, corner, and destroy each of the Avengers. They were stronger together, so taking them down one by one rather than as a unit was their strategy.

“(Y/N),” your dad said, getting your attention. You had been zoning out, staring at your hands and twirling your pen between your fingers. “Your target is-” He paused and flicked through some of his papers. “-Spider-Man.” You took in a sharp breath that made everyone turn to look at you. Your dad raised his eyebrows. “Is that a problem?” he asked.

“I just,” you stuttered through your words, “I’m doing it alone?”

“Our sources say Spider-Man is a low threat,” he explained. “This should be a simple task for you to handle independently.” He looked at you sternly. “Is that a problem?” You clenched your jaw and shook your head no.

“No sir,” you said. “That won’t be a problem.” Your father gave you a short nod and handed you his packet on Spider-Man. You flicked through it, feeling numb and tuning out the rest of the meeting. Hydra knew Peter was Spider-Man because SHIELD knew, and SHIELD knew because the Avengers knew. You stared at all the information on Peter. Where he lived. Where he went to school. His family. His usual evening routine.

It all made you sick.

How were you supposed to do this? Capture -and kill?- your best friend, or become your father’s enemy. Sure, your dad was evil, but he was still your dad. He would still love you even if you didn’t want to be Hydra, right? Still, you couldn’t help but consider the worst case scenario. Would he kill you if you went against his beliefs and stood firm in your own? You knew better than to underestimate him.

The next night, you suited up and crept out of the Hydra facility. At that time of night -10:00- Peter would be swinging around Queens on patrol. You had a loose version of a plan, and every part of it involved betraying your best friend.

You hid in the shadows of one of the alleys you knew Peter frequently passed. When you found out he was Spider-Man, he took you on his patrol route just for fun. You loved swinging the New York skies with him. At the exact time you expected him, Peter swung down from the sky and landed in the alley. His eyes scanned the darkness, unable to find you in your stealth suit. So, the minute he walked by, you knocked him unconscious before he could see you.

Every member of Hydra had their own designated area to complete their mission that night. That way, each member’s task of kidnapping, torturing, and killing (if necessary) could be done independently and without the watchful eyes of other members of Hydra. Because Hydra also lived by your dad’s second motto: don’t trust anyone. To Hydra, that included each other.

When you got to your location, you stripped Peter of his suit and tied him to a chair. You cringed the entire time, realizing that it all looked far more sexual than you intended it to. But you knew what Peter’s suit could do, and leaving him in it would give you a definite disadvantage.

You stayed behind Peter, not wanting him to see your face as soon as he came to. When he did, he lifted his head slowly and turned his head to the side, then tugged on his restraints. Even his super strength wouldn’t be able to get him out of his bondage. You had made sure of it. “Show yourself!” Peter shouted. You felt your lower lip quiver as his movements to escape became rougher. You knew what your next step was. You just hated it. This was your least favorite part of the mission you had planned.

You slowly stepped in front of Peter, hoping you looked more confident than you felt. “(Y/N)?” Peter asked. His eyebrows were furrowed, his eyes full of confusion. “What’s going on? What the hell are you doing?”

“I’m sorry,” you said. Your voice cracked horribly. “I’m so sorry.”

“(Y/N) please,” Peter begged. “Tell me what you’re doing.” You cleared your throat. You didn’t know how to tell him. How do you tell your best friend that you’re part of an organization created by Nazis?

“Peter, I’m Hydra.”

Okay. There were probably better ways to say that.

Peter laughed. He actually laughed, tossing his head back and screwing his eyes shut. When he finally caught his breath, he looked at you again. As soon as he saw you weren’t returning his smile, his face dropped. “What do you mean?” he asked. “You’re joking, right? You can’t actually be Hydra.”

Peter finally studied your outfit more. When he noticed the Hydra patch on your shoulder, he took in a sharp breath. “No,” he said, shaking his head. “No. This isn’t real. I’m dreaming. You’re not Hydra.”

“I’m sorry,” you said again. Tears were coming to your eyes now. “It’s my dad. I don’t, I don’t want to be. You have to know that.”

“So why the hell are you doing this?” he asked. His voice cracked as tears came to his eyes as well.

“You don’t know what it’s like,” you said. “I can’t. If I defied him, I don’t know what he’d do.”

“Okay, so why am I here?” he asked, tugging at his restraints again.

“We’ve all been assigned a target,” you said. Tears were streaming down your face, but you couldn’t look away from Peter. You knew you had to look him in the eyes while you said this. You owed him that much. Peter’s eyes grew wide, and his lips parted.

“M-Me?” he stuttered.

“I wish it wasn’t you,” you said, “but it is, and I’m so sorry.”

“So what are you going to do?” he asked. He wasn’t hurt anymore. He was mad. “Kill me? Torture me?”

“I’m just supposed to hold you here,” you said. “I have to get information out of you about, about your plan to take down the Hydra bases.”

“And if I don’t tell you?” he said. You pressed your lips together and shook your head.

“Please don’t make me say it,” you said.

“Do it,” Peter almost shouted. “Fucking kill me! Because I’m not telling you anything!”

“You think I want to do this?” you yelled, throwing your arms in the air. “I’m telling you, you don’t understand what it’s like being a part of this!”

“Then explain it to me!”

“If I don’t do this, I think my dad will kill me!”

Silence rang throughout the room. Peter’s original look of anger softened and was replaced by pity. You almost preferred the anger. If there was one emotion you hated, it was pity. That was probably your dad’s influence on you. “Jesus Christ, (Y/N),” he said. “Why haven’t you ever told me?”

“Because SHIELD is everything to you,” you said. “They’re everything good, and I’m like a glorified Nazi!”

“Yeah but not by choice,” Peter said. “You’re good in your heart. I know that.”

“I don’t know what to do,” you said, your voice dropping.

“I do,” he said. “You’re going to untie me, and I’m going to take you to the compound. They’ll keep you safe.”

“I don’t think it’s that easy,” you whispered, hanging your head.

“I promise you, it is,” he said. “This is your chance to turn it all around. I won’t let anyone hurt you.” You met your eyes with his and saw the sincerity in them. Another tear fell from your eyes as you walked up to him and undid his restraints. With no hesitation, Peter wrapped his arms around you and pulled you in for a hug. You cried softly into his shoulder, and Peter let you with no complaint. Finally, you pulled away from each other, and Peter tugged his suit back on. For the first time in your life, you felt good. You weren’t Ward. And you weren’t your dad. You were you. And you believed in heroes.

You and Peter headed towards the doors of the building you were in. You felt invincible. Peter filled you with hope.

As soon as you opened the door to head outside, you came face to face with your father. You jumped and put your arm in front of Peter protectively. Your dad sighed and shook his head, disappointment written all over his face.

“I knew I saw a weakness in you.”

Don’t trust anyone, ever. Especially me.

When you entered high school, things changed. You changed. You were more exposed to other opinions and so many good people who believed in good. Believed in SHIELD. Believed in heroes. At Midtown High, you became friends with Peter, Ned, and MJ. It made everything in your life so confusing. You started to question the exact principles you were raised on. Your friends stood for everything your dad was against. Everything you were raised to be against. Especially Peter. Peter was all about the Avengers. He spoke so earnestly about what they stood for that, soon enough, you started to believe in them too.

And then, you did the really stupid thing, and you fell in love with Peter. Peter who your dad would despise. Peter who worshiped SHIELD and stood for everything good. Peter who you knew was Spider-Man.

Peter, Peter, Peter.

Just like that, the first of your father’s mottos was ignored.

You can’t ever get attached to anyone or anything.

You loved your friends more than anything. You couldn’t imagine your teenage years without them. You were attached. If anything happened to them, you had no idea what you would do. That’s why you hated every mission that pinned Hydra against the Avengers. It put Peter in immediate danger, but you couldn’t say anything to anybody about it. You couldn’t warn Peter of Hydra’s plans, because it would make Peter see who you really were. That was an identity you were trying so hard to hide from him. But you couldn’t ask your dad to ease up on the heroes, because that would show your weakness. The weakness you were supposed to fight.

You were stuck between a rock and a hard place.

When you turned 16, your dad decided it was time for you to suit up and join the team. His team. Hydra. Your worst nightmare was coming true. Deep down, you always knew the day would come, but you had delusionally told yourself that it wouldn’t. You had to pretend you had been waiting for the day, when in reality you had been dreading it.

[[MORE]]

You had heard the stories of recruits from days’ past. You knew Grant Ward. You knew about his life and all of the events that lead up to his initiation. You knew the aftermath of his recruitment, how he dropped Fitz and Simmons -two respected agents of SHIELD- in the bottom of the ocean. You knew. You knew about it all. And you knew your dad expected you to turn out the same. He expected you to kill the things you were attached to. To get rid of your weaknesses.

But you couldn’t do it. You couldn’t do it, because you weren’t Ward. You weren’t evil. You couldn’t look your dog in the eyes and kill it. That was it. That was the initiation. Kill the thing you loved. So, when your dad left you in the middle of the woods with Sparky -the dog you grew up with- and a gun, you shot a bullet into the air and let your dog run free. What your dad didn’t know didn’t hurt.

Still, this meant you were Hydra now. You were a part of it all. A part of all the evil. The worst thing was not having any friends to confide in. The night of your initiation, you had to cry yourself to sleep with the guilt of being evil weighing on your chest. Alone.

The next day, you were in your first Hydra mission meeting. You sat around the table with people you knew by name from hearing endless praise from your dad. Your dad sat at the head, giving a rundown of the mission. With your intel at SHIELD, you knew all of the insider details. This also meant you knew that the Avengers were on a mission to destroy all of Hydra’s bases. In order to beat them to the punch, Hydra’s mission was to find, corner, and destroy each of the Avengers. They were stronger together, so taking them down one by one rather than as a unit was their strategy.

“(Y/N),” your dad said, getting your attention. You had been zoning out, staring at your hands and twirling your pen between your fingers. “Your target is-” He paused and flicked through some of his papers. “-Spider-Man.” You took in a sharp breath that made everyone turn to look at you. Your dad raised his eyebrows. “Is that a problem?” he asked.

“I just,” you stuttered through your words, “I’m doing it alone?”

“Our sources say Spider-Man is a low threat,” he explained. “This should be a simple task for you to handle independently.” He looked at you sternly. “Is that a problem?” You clenched your jaw and shook your head no.

“No sir,” you said. “That won’t be a problem.” Your father gave you a short nod and handed you his packet on Spider-Man. You flicked through it, feeling numb and tuning out the rest of the meeting. Hydra knew Peter was Spider-Man because SHIELD knew, and SHIELD knew because the Avengers knew. You stared at all the information on Peter. Where he lived. Where he went to school. His family. His usual evening routine.

It all made you sick.

How were you supposed to do this? Capture -and kill?- your best friend, or become your father’s enemy. Sure, your dad was evil, but he was still your dad. He would still love you even if you didn’t want to be Hydra, right? Still, you couldn’t help but consider the worst case scenario. Would he kill you if you went against his beliefs and stood firm in your own? You knew better than to underestimate him.

The next night, you suited up and crept out of the Hydra facility. At that time of night -10:00- Peter would be swinging around Queens on patrol. You had a loose version of a plan, and every part of it involved betraying your best friend.

You hid in the shadows of one of the alleys you knew Peter frequently passed. When you found out he was Spider-Man, he took you on his patrol route just for fun. You loved swinging the New York skies with him. At the exact time you expected him, Peter swung down from the sky and landed in the alley. His eyes scanned the darkness, unable to find you in your stealth suit. So, the minute he walked by, you knocked him unconscious before he could see you.

Every member of Hydra had their own designated area to complete their mission that night. That way, each member’s task of kidnapping, torturing, and killing (if necessary) could be done independently and without the watchful eyes of other members of Hydra. Because Hydra also lived by your dad’s second motto: don’t trust anyone. To Hydra, that included each other.

When you got to your location, you stripped Peter of his suit and tied him to a chair. You cringed the entire time, realizing that it all looked far more sexual than you intended it to. But you knew what Peter’s suit could do, and leaving him in it would give you a definite disadvantage.

You stayed behind Peter, not wanting him to see your face as soon as he came to. When he did, he lifted his head slowly and turned his head to the side, then tugged on his restraints. Even his super strength wouldn’t be able to get him out of his bondage. You had made sure of it. “Show yourself!” Peter shouted. You felt your lower lip quiver as his movements to escape became rougher. You knew what your next step was. You just hated it. This was your least favorite part of the mission you had planned.

You slowly stepped in front of Peter, hoping you looked more confident than you felt. “(Y/N)?” Peter asked. His eyebrows were furrowed, his eyes full of confusion. “What’s going on? What the hell are you doing?”

“I’m sorry,” you said. Your voice cracked horribly. “I’m so sorry.”

“(Y/N) please,” Peter begged. “Tell me what you’re doing.” You cleared your throat. You didn’t know how to tell him. How do you tell your best friend that you’re part of an organization created by Nazis?

“Peter, I’m Hydra.”

Okay. There were probably better ways to say that.

Peter laughed. He actually laughed, tossing his head back and screwing his eyes shut. When he finally caught his breath, he looked at you again. As soon as he saw you weren’t returning his smile, his face dropped. “What do you mean?” he asked. “You’re joking, right? You can’t actually be Hydra.”

Peter finally studied your outfit more. When he noticed the Hydra patch on your shoulder, he took in a sharp breath. “No,” he said, shaking his head. “No. This isn’t real. I’m dreaming. You’re not Hydra.”

“I’m sorry,” you said again. Tears were coming to your eyes now. “It’s my dad. I don’t, I don’t want to be. You have to know that.”

“So why the hell are you doing this?” he asked. His voice cracked as tears came to his eyes as well.

“You don’t know what it’s like,” you said. “I can’t. If I defied him, I don’t know what he’d do.”

“Okay, so why am I here?” he asked, tugging at his restraints again.

“We’ve all been assigned a target,” you said. Tears were streaming down your face, but you couldn’t look away from Peter. You knew you had to look him in the eyes while you said this. You owed him that much. Peter’s eyes grew wide, and his lips parted.

“M-Me?” he stuttered.

“I wish it wasn’t you,” you said, “but it is, and I’m so sorry.”

“So what are you going to do?” he asked. He wasn’t hurt anymore. He was mad. “Kill me? Torture me?”

“I’m just supposed to hold you here,” you said. “I have to get information out of you about, about your plan to take down the Hydra bases.”

“And if I don’t tell you?” he said. You pressed your lips together and shook your head.

“Please don’t make me say it,” you said.

“Do it,” Peter almost shouted. “Fucking kill me! Because I’m not telling you anything!”

“You think I want to do this?” you yelled, throwing your arms in the air. “I’m telling you, you don’t understand what it’s like being a part of this!”

“Then explain it to me!”

“If I don’t do this, I think my dad will kill me!”

Silence rang throughout the room. Peter’s original look of anger softened and was replaced by pity. You almost preferred the anger. If there was one emotion you hated, it was pity. That was probably your dad’s influence on you. “Jesus Christ, (Y/N),” he said. “Why haven’t you ever told me?”

“Because SHIELD is everything to you,” you said. “They’re everything good, and I’m like a glorified Nazi!”

“Yeah but not by choice,” Peter said. “You’re good in your heart. I know that.”

“I don’t know what to do,” you said, your voice dropping.

“I do,” he said. “You’re going to untie me, and I’m going to take you to the compound. They’ll keep you safe.”

“I don’t think it’s that easy,” you whispered, hanging your head.

“I promise you, it is,” he said. “This is your chance to turn it all around. I won’t let anyone hurt you.” You met your eyes with his and saw the sincerity in them. Another tear fell from your eyes as you walked up to him and undid his restraints. With no hesitation, Peter wrapped his arms around you and pulled you in for a hug. You cried softly into his shoulder, and Peter let you with no complaint. Finally, you pulled away from each other, and Peter tugged his suit back on. For the first time in your life, you felt good. You weren’t Ward. And you weren’t your dad. You were you. And you believed in heroes.

You and Peter headed towards the doors of the building you were in. You felt invincible. Peter filled you with hope.

As soon as you opened the door to head outside, you came face to face with your father. You jumped and put your arm in front of Peter protectively. Your dad sighed and shook his head, disappointment written all over his face.

“I knew I saw a weakness in you.”

Don’t trust anyone, ever. Especially me.

He would still love you even if you didn’t want to be Hydra, right? Still, you couldn’t help but consider the worst case scenario. Would he kill you if you went against his beliefs and stood firm in your own? You knew better than to underestimate him.

The next night, you suited up and crept out of the Hydra facility. At that time of night -10:00- Peter would be swinging around Queens on patrol. You had a loose version of a plan, and every part of it involved betraying your best friend.

You hid in the shadows of one of the alleys you knew Peter frequently passed. When you found out he was Spider-Man, he took you on his patrol route just for fun. You loved swinging the New York skies with him. At the exact time you expected him, Peter swung down from the sky and landed in the alley. His eyes scanned the darkness, unable to find you in your stealth suit. So, the minute he walked by, you knocked him unconscious before he could see you.

Every member of Hydra had their own designated area to complete their mission that night. That way, each member’s task of kidnapping, torturing, and killing (if necessary) could be done independently and without the watchful eyes of other members of Hydra. Because Hydra also lived by your dad’s second motto: don’t trust anyone. To Hydra, that included each other.

When you got to your location, you stripped Peter of his suit and tied him to a chair. You cringed the entire time, realizing that it all looked far more sexual than you intended it to. But you knew what Peter’s suit could do, and leaving him in it would give you a definite disadvantage.

You stayed behind Peter, not wanting him to see your face as soon as he came to. When he did, he lifted his head slowly and turned his head to the side, then tugged on his restraints. Even his super strength wouldn’t be able to get him out of his bondage. You had made sure of it. “Show yourself!” Peter shouted. You felt your lower lip quiver as his movements to escape became rougher. You knew what your next step was. You just hated it. This was your least favorite part of the mission you had planned.

You slowly stepped in front of Peter, hoping you looked more confident than you felt. “(Y/N)?” Peter asked. His eyebrows were furrowed, his eyes full of confusion. “What’s going on? What the hell are you doing?”

“I’m sorry,” you said. Your voice cracked horribly. “I’m so sorry.”

“(Y/N) please,” Peter begged. “Tell me what you’re doing.” You cleared your throat. You didn’t know how to tell him. How do you tell your best friend that you’re part of an organization created by Nazis?

“Peter, I’m Hydra.”

Okay. There were probably better ways to say that.

Peter laughed. He actually laughed, tossing his head back and screwing his eyes shut. When he finally caught his breath, he looked at you again. As soon as he saw you weren’t returning his smile, his face dropped. “What do you mean?” he asked. “You’re joking, right? You can’t actually be Hydra.”

Peter finally studied your outfit more. When he noticed the Hydra patch on your shoulder, he took in a sharp breath. “No,” he said, shaking his head. “No. This isn’t real. I’m dreaming. You’re not Hydra.”

“I’m sorry,” you said again. Tears were coming to your eyes now. “It’s my dad. I don’t, I don’t want to be. You have to know that.”

“So why the hell are you doing this?” he asked. His voice cracked as tears came to his eyes as well.

“You don’t know what it’s like,” you said. “I can’t. If I defied him, I don’t know what he’d do.”

“Okay, so why am I here?” he asked, tugging at his restraints again.

“We’ve all been assigned a target,” you said. Tears were streaming down your face, but you couldn’t look away from Peter. You knew you had to look him in the eyes while you said this. You owed him that much. Peter’s eyes grew wide, and his lips parted.

“M-Me?” he stuttered.

“I wish it wasn’t you,” you said, “but it is, and I’m so sorry.”

“So what are you going to do?” he asked. He wasn’t hurt anymore. He was mad. “Kill me? Torture me?”

“I’m just supposed to hold you here,” you said. “I have to get information out of you about, about your plan to take down the Hydra bases.”

“And if I don’t tell you?” he said. You pressed your lips together and shook your head.

“Please don’t make me say it,” you said.

“Do it,” Peter almost shouted. “Fucking kill me! Because I’m not telling you anything!”

“You think I want to do this?” you yelled, throwing your arms in the air. “I’m telling you, you don’t understand what it’s like being a part of this!”

“Then explain it to me!”

“If I don’t do this, I think my dad will kill me!”

Silence rang throughout the room. Peter’s original look of anger softened and was replaced by pity. You almost preferred the anger. If there was one emotion you hated, it was pity. That was probably your dad’s influence on you. “Jesus Christ, (Y/N),” he said. “Why haven’t you ever told me?”

“Because SHIELD is everything to you,” you said. “They’re everything good, and I’m like a glorified Nazi!”

“Yeah but not by choice,” Peter said. “You’re good in your heart. I know that.”

“I don’t know what to do,” you said, your voice dropping.

“I do,” he said. “You’re going to untie me, and I’m going to take you to the compound. They’ll keep you safe.”

“I don’t think it’s that easy,” you whispered, hanging your head.

“I promise you, it is,” he said. “This is your chance to turn it all around. I won’t let anyone hurt you.” You met your eyes with his and saw the sincerity in them. Another tear fell from your eyes as you walked up to him and undid his restraints. With no hesitation, Peter wrapped his arms around you and pulled you in for a hug. You cried softly into his shoulder, and Peter let you with no complaint. Finally, you pulled away from each other, and Peter tugged his suit back on. For the first time in your life, you felt good. You weren’t Ward. And you weren’t your dad. You were you. And you believed in heroes.

You and Peter headed towards the doors of the building you were in. You felt invincible. Peter filled you with hope.

As soon as you opened the door to head outside, you came face to face with your father. You jumped and put your arm in front of Peter protectively. Your dad sighed and shook his head, disappointment written all over his face.

“I knew I saw a weakness in you.”

Don’t trust anyone, ever. Especially me.

pairing - Peter x Hydra!reader
word count - 2,283
warnings - I guess there’s a Season 1 Agent of SHIELD spoiler
A/N - this is for @blissfulparker‘s 5K Writing Challenge! | prompt:  “I wish it wasn’t you but it is, and I’m so sorry.” | I’m pretty proud of this but for some reason I feel like it won’t be very popular lol

summary - You’re not proud of your background and the reputation your last name gives you. When your first mission comes and it involves your best friend, you’re stuck between a rock and a hard place. Are you on the side of your dad, or the side of heroes?

As Shakespeare once wrote, “Some people are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.”

If that statement was true, then the reverse must also be true. Some people are born evil, some achieve evil, and some have evil thrust upon them.

You were a combination of the first and last.

Your dad was John Garret. Known under many aliases, including Deathlok and the Clairvoyant, he was a powerful member of Hydra. You were raised hearing his two twisted mottos:

First, You can’t ever get attached to anyone or anything. You have to fight that weakness inside you.

And second, Don’t trust anyone, ever. Especially me.

For most of your life, you just went along with it. Your dad was evil, so you felt like you were born evil. The evil was thrust upon you. You weren’t given a choice between one side or the other. Growing up, you didn’t know any better anyway. You agreed with the things your dad told you because it was the only thing you heard. Hydra was superior. SHIELD were the wrong ones. You had no reason to ever question him. For your whole life, you proudly hailed Hydra.

When you entered high school, things changed. You changed. You were more exposed to other opinions and so many good people who believed in good. Believed in SHIELD. Believed in heroes. At Midtown High, you became friends with Peter, Ned, and MJ. It made everything in your life so confusing. You started to question the exact principles you were raised on. Your friends stood for everything your dad was against. Everything you were raised to be against. Especially Peter. Peter was all about the Avengers. He spoke so earnestly about what they stood for that, soon enough, you started to believe in them too.

And then, you did the really stupid thing, and you fell in love with Peter. Peter who your dad would despise. Peter who worshiped SHIELD and stood for everything good. Peter who you knew was Spider-Man.

Peter, Peter, Peter.

Just like that, the first of your father’s mottos was ignored.

You can’t ever get attached to anyone or anything.

You loved your friends more than anything. You couldn’t imagine your teenage years without them. You were attached. If anything happened to them, you had no idea what you would do. That’s why you hated every mission that pinned Hydra against the Avengers. It put Peter in immediate danger, but you couldn’t say anything to anybody about it. You couldn’t warn Peter of Hydra’s plans, because it would make Peter see who you really were. That was an identity you were trying so hard to hide from him. But you couldn’t ask your dad to ease up on the heroes, because that would show your weakness. The weakness you were supposed to fight.

You were stuck between a rock and a hard place.

When you turned 16, your dad decided it was time for you to suit up and join the team. His team. Hydra. Your worst nightmare was coming true. Deep down, you always knew the day would come, but you had delusionally told yourself that it wouldn’t. You had to pretend you had been waiting for the day, when in reality you had been dreading it.

So, reddit has some Spider-Man: Far From Home spoilers that I’m fairly certain are true. I’m not sure how I feel about some of it, especially having seen the clips already out and how they might tie into the rest of the movie, idk.

I do know that if what I’m worried about is not done right, emotion and plot wise, I will be pissed off. I definitely need specific things to happen, in regards to the spoilers and how Peter reacts to them.

summary: For You (p.p.)
title: For You (p.p.)
body:
summary: you’d just gotten dumped and had been wallowing in it for what was probably way too long. good thing there was peter.

pairing: college!peter parker x reader

warnings: language, angst, kissing ;)

word count: 3k

a/n: i’m so fucking proud of this!! this is probably my favorite thing i’ve ever written on this blog, so i hope you guys like it!! (also i might be starting to write smut sometime in the not too distant future…..) okay bye!!

It was two in the morning. You were still awake… and very drunk. Very drunk— which is never a good state for you to be in. But that’s what happens when you’re left alone, sad, on a Friday evening. Your roommate’s family lived close to the ESU campus, so she’d often go home for the weekend, most of your friends were home this weekend, but not you. You’d rather cry yourself to sleep while drinking your secret stash of booze than go home right now.

Just hours previous to that very moment, you’d gotten dumped. Via text. Why did it have to be text? This isn’t high school, you were adults in college for christ’s sake! Your now ex-boyfriend constructed a long and drawn out paragraph, spelling out how he’d “been seeing someone else for a month,” and how he “didn’t love you anymore,” and that he “wished you the best and would always have love in his heart for you.”

Hypocrite.

You’d finished reading the text over again, the now three-quarters full bottle sitting precariously on your chest, and threw your phone against the uncomfortable twin mattress. You hated that you were wallowing in it, you hated that he made you cry, you hated that you felt like you didn’t know what to do without him— boys shouldn’t make you feel like that. You pushed yourself into more of a sitting position and lifted the bottle to your mouth, the room temperature alcohol slid down your throat and warmed your stomach. At least that was helping.

You jumped at the sound of knocking at your dorm room window, out of the corner of your eye you caught sight of a bright red suit and a familiar looking mask.

“Y/N, let me in!” his voice was muffled by both the glass and the mask over his face. You stood and wiped your eyes before walking over to the window and sliding it open. Your spidey-suited friend, Peter, climbed his way through and landed not-so-gracefully on the floor. “Shit,” he muttered as his butt connected with the ugly carpet.

You stood over him for a second before returning to your bed. Peter stumbled back to his feet and pulled off his mask, his hair was messy and his face had a slight sheen that had been built up due to the stuffiness under the suit.

You felt the bed dip with his weight once he sat down next to you and you take another drink. And then another.

“Are you gonna talk to me or am I going to have to web that bottle to the other side of the room?” you cradled the bottle close to your chest and glared at him.

“You wouldn’t dare,” you slurred and squeezed it tighter against you. Peter rolled his eyes and you finally set it down. You pulled your legs up onto the bed and sat with your chin between your knees. “He,” you start to say between hiccups. “He dumped me.”

“What?” you could hear the shock in his voice. You leaned over and grabbed your still unlocked phone to give to him. Silence fell over the two of you as he read the lengthy paragraph. “I’ll always love you? What kind of shit is that?” you shrugged and took yet another drink, Peter sighed. “I’m sorry, Y/N.”

That fucking asshole.

You nodded, as tears started to form in your eyes again. There was a painful lump in your throat. “Thanks, Pete.”

You felt his arm snake around your shoulders and you allowed yourself to collapse into him, sad sniffs and sobs escaped your lips as the two of you sat in silence, his hand rubbing your shoulder comfortingly. You were so thankful for him.

Peter had to control himself. He wanted to get up and punch that asshole right in the face for hurting you. He knew you didn’t deserve that.

You and Peter became fast friends during your first year of college. You came to ESU from out of state and didn’t have any friends when you arrived, Peter’s situation was similar, except that he was the only one of his friends that decided to stay in-state. The two of you met on move-in day and from then on you stuck by each other.

Peter also never liked your ex. You met him during your second semester of freshman year and it didn’t take his spidey-senses to know that he was no good. But he didn’t say anything. You were happy, and Peter liked seeing you happy. Even though it killed him every time he saw you together.

“I’m going to beat the shit out of him,” Peter piped up, trying to lighten the mood. You laughed and sniffled.

“No you’re not,” you said.

“Yeah you’re right, he’ll probably just have an unfortunate fall down the stairs one day,” you laughed again. Happy that you were starting to smile, Peter continued with his list of “accidents” that could befall him. “Or, you know, his room will start to smell really bad because he somehow left a carton of milk out. Or he’ll lose his key and get locked out of his dorm because they somehow got stuck on the ceiling—”

You shoved him and wiped your nose with the back of your arm, a small smile still on your face. You collected yourself for a moment then made a pathetic attempt to stand up, which resulted in you almost toppling over. Peter stood up and caught you by the shoulders. You moaned in protest as he sat you back down.

“I want to get up…” you whined. Peter shook his head and leaned you against the wall. You hadn’t realized he had left to get you water until he was back and putting it in your hands. He had somehow managed to change out of his suit and into normal clothes without you even noticing. You gratefully accepted the water and chugged it— not realizing how thirsty you actually were.

It was an ungraceful act, and water had managed to trickle down your chin and onto your clothes. Peter stood next to the bed and watched as you started to lay down. You were ready to close your eyes and sleep, but as soon as your head touched the pillow you felt your stomach start to churn.

“Peter,” you started, but you couldn’t finish your sentence. The room was spinning and you knew you wouldn’t make it to the bathroom. Luckily, he was one step ahead of you. Peter, trash can at the ready, got there just in time. Your throat and stomach were hot as you proceeded to expel all of the toxins and food you’d consumed that day. You pulled back, your throat burning, cheeks hot with embarrassment, and felt your eyes well with tears again. “I’m sorry,” you said to him. “That’s so fucking gross, I’m sorry—”

You felt the rough surface of a paper towel on your chin as he cleaned you up. “Oh stop,” he said quietly. “You’ve stitched me up more times than I can count, the least I could do is help you through this,” that was true. Perks of being friends with a med student: they need to practice suturing. Something Peter needed a lot of.

You smiled again and took the towel from him to finish the job. A terrible taste lingered in your mouth.

“Can you, uh,” you pointed at your shower caddy. Peter grabbed your toothbrush and toothpaste, holding them out to you for confirmation. You nodded and he helped you to the bathroom. You gripped the edge of the sink tightly and Peter stood at the sink next to yours to wash his hands.

“Your guys’ bathroom is really clean,” he said once he’d finished. He pulled back one of the shower curtains. He had never been in the bathroom on the girl’s floors before, man he was jealous. “Not really what I expected but still, must be nice.”

You spat into the sink and looked at him. “What did you expect?” you asked.

“I dunno, like… maybe a guy handing you hot towels… or like the Ritz.”

“Oh shut up!” you laughed. Peter smiled and took your hand to lead you back to your room. You tried to untie your shoes but immediately regretted it as you bent over. “Here, I’ll do it,” he helped your shoes off and grabbed you some pajamas, which you took happily. He was always so nice to you.

Peter looked around awkwardly. “Should I, uh, go?” he asked. He knew the boundaries, but you didn’t want him to leave. Not yet.

“Just um…” you looked for somewhere he could go, but you were trapped in a tiny dorm, it’s not like he could just go to the other room. “Turn around okay? And promise not to look.”

He nodded and turned his back wordlessly. His head hung low, looking at his feet. You did the same. With your back to him, you began to get undressed— this should have felt awkward. You were best friends, something like seeing you naked could be a friendship-ender. But it wasn’t. It felt safe, intimate, you were way more comfortable doing this around Peter than you ever were with your ex.

You pushed those thoughts from your mind and turned back around. “Okay, I’m done.”

Peter lifted his head and faced you, a goofy smile came to his face once he saw the shirt you were wearing. “The Amazing Spider-Man, huh?”

“I thought you did that on purpose!” you laughed and looked down at the bright red, extra-long shirt. He’d grabbed you a pair of sleeping shorts and this t-shirt that you’d gotten way before you’d ever met him, before you’d known his secret.

“I just grabbed the first thing I saw! When did you get that?” you shrugged.

“Spider-Man has always been my favorite superhero,” Peter laughed and you glanced towards your bed, the desire for sleep growing ever stronger. You pulled back your duvet and climbed in. You heard the soft ‘thunk’ of him setting down the, thankfully now empty, trash can and pulled the covers up to your chin.

Your eyes grew heavier and heavier, and you were half asleep when you mumbled: “Peter,”

He turned around and saw that your eyes were closed. He was about to brush it off and head out the door when he heard you again.

“Please, stay,” your speech slurred thanks to the mix of alcohol and sleep. “At least until I fall asleep,” He looked at you for another minute before gently kicking off his shoes. He couldn’t say no to you. He sat down at the edge of your bed and you curled your body tighter to make more room for him. His hand rested gently on your calf over the sheets and he leaned his head against the wall.

“Of course, Y/N,” he said quietly as sleep began to tug at his eyes too.

+      +      +      +      +

You opened your eyes and were greeted by your too bright room. You’d forgotten to close your curtains so the sunlight was streaming in, which would have been nice had it not been for your splitting headache. You sat up slowly, bringing your legs in so that you were sitting criss-cross-applesauce, and stretched, the sound of soft breathing caught your attention. There was Peter, his head tilted back in a way that couldn’t be comfortable, his mouth slightly open, asleep against your wall.

He’d stayed the whole time.

You leaned over and shook his shoulder gently, which made him jump a little as he sat up. You watched as he rolled his neck, trying to stretch out the ache that had started right above his spine.

“Hey,” you said quietly. His hair was matted down in the back, his eyes were twisted shut, his skin basically glowing in the morning sun. You couldn’t deny…

“Hi,” he said back and opened one eye to look at you. Your hair was slightly messy, your cheeks were tinted pink, your lips were— unknowingly— parted ever so slightly. He couldn’t help it…

You wanted to kiss him so badly.
He wanted to kiss you so badly.

Your hand traveled down from his shoulder to his hand which had been planted on the surface of the bed. The two of you looked down and then back up at each other. The silence that permeated the room was heavy, and yet still comfortable. Everything unsaid, undone, hung in that silence. Slowly, you leaned forward, Peter did the same.

The kiss started out gentle, his soft lips barely pressing against yours, pulling away after a few seconds, testing the waters to make sure that this was okay. Then it deepened. He angled his body so that he could face you better, his weight resting on his knees, hands on your hips as he nipped gently at your bottom lip. The short, sharp sensation followed by the softness of his tongue made you whimper. Your hands flew around his neck and up into his hair as you uncrossed your legs.

He pushed himself closer to you, your legs on either side of his as the kiss deepened again. Tongue, teeth, and morning breath (which the two of you ignored as you were too caught up in other things.) You began to lay back slowly and pulled him down with you. His body on top of yours made you gasp again and it was your turn to take a bite of him. A low growl escaped his throat, a noise you never thought Peter Parker could make, and he moved from your lips to your jaw. Your hands gripped his back as he gently kissed down your neck.

“Is this,” he started, his lips hovering over the shell of your ear. “Is this okay?” you nodded.

“Yes, it’s great— Peter!” his name came out in a moan as he sucked at the base of your jaw. “Oh…” you gasped. You had no idea that was a sweet spot for you. Your ex had never paid attention to how your body responded. You tugged at his hair as he continued to lick and bite around your neck, making sure not to stay in one spot for too long so that he didn’t leave a massive mark.

Somehow, you flipped him over. You straddled him as you brought your lips back down to his, and he happily parted them for you. You decided to follow what he’d just done to you and kissed down his neck, biting and sucking until you heard him let out another deep growl. You lingered there, just above his collar bone.

“F—fuck!” he whined. One hand made its way under the red fabric of your shirt and rested on the bare skin of your waist. “Y/N, oh my god.”

You looked up at him, his lips were pink and swollen as he let out a few faint gasps, his hair was starting to stick to his forehead. You loved seeing him like this, you wanted this to last forever. But something stopped you. You felt a slight pain, not physical, when you thought about the idea of going further.

You kissed back up to his lips and gave him one final peck before sitting up, guilt suddenly flowed through you. Peter sat up too, laying his weight on his elbows as you were still on top of him— which he didn’t mind.

“Are you okay?” he asked once he noticed you had looked down at your hands.

“I um, I don’t think I can… you know ‘go all the way.’ not right now at least,” Peter cocked his head to the side. “I’m sorry if that’s what you wanted… I’m sorry if I made you think that—” he reached up to cup your cheek, the soft pad of his thumb ran gently over your skin.

“Whatever you want, Y/N,” he said. “I’m okay with,” he had a small smile on his face.

“You’re not… upset?”

“Of course not! This,” he said and gestured at you. “Is enough.”

You smiled back at him and leaned down to kiss him one more time— softer than before, your hand cradled his cheek. You pulled away and rested your forehead on his, this closeness you felt with Peter had been completely foreign until now. And you knew that you wouldn’t feel it with anyone else.

You heard your phone chime and picked it up. It was a snap from your ex, against your better judgment you opened it. He had his arm wrapped around a blonde girl that you’d never seen before, cheesy grins on both of their faces.

‘Streaks!!🔥🔥 Party tonight in N-building! Second floor!!!!!’ it read. You grimaced. Peter got the same notification.

“What a dick,” he said. You shrugged and tossed your phone back on the bed before standing. Peter glanced at you and sucked in a sharp breath. “Shit! Sorry!”

“What?” he tapped his neck and you looked at yourself in your mirror. Right below your jaw, a purple mark started to bloom.

“I thought I was being careful,” he said shyly. You laughed and made your way over to him. You pulled down the collar of his shirt and saw his own deep hickey.

“It’s okay, we’re even,” you winked. Peter watched as you opened your closet to find something to wear. That asshole had no idea what he was missing with you. Peter wanted him to know it.

“Let’s go.”

“What?”

“To his party. Let’s go!” you shook your head at him.

“You’re high.”

“No, I’m serious! He deserves to see what he’s missing. And it’ll really piss him off to see that,” he said and pointed at your neck. “Especially if he knows it was left by me.”

You shrugged and he stood up to make his way over to you. His chin rested on your shoulder, arms around your waist. Your heart fluttered, he just made you feel so goddamn warm.

“C’mon, Y/N. Let’s stir some shit up.”

You giggled at that and turned to face him, still in his grasp. “Alright,” you said, wrapping your arms around his neck. “I’m in.”

Just hours previous to that very moment, you’d gotten dumped. Via text. Why did it have to be text? This isn’t high school, you were adults in college for christ’s sake! Your now ex-boyfriend constructed a long and drawn out paragraph, spelling out how he’d “been seeing someone else for a month,” and how he “didn’t love you anymore,” and that he “wished you the best and would always have love in his heart for you.”

Hypocrite.

[[MORE]]

You’d finished reading the text over again, the now three-quarters full bottle sitting precariously on your chest, and threw your phone against the uncomfortable twin mattress. You hated that you were wallowing in it, you hated that he made you cry, you hated that you felt like you didn’t know what to do without him— boys shouldn’t make you feel like that. You pushed yourself into more of a sitting position and lifted the bottle to your mouth, the room temperature alcohol slid down your throat and warmed your stomach. At least that was helping.

You jumped at the sound of knocking at your dorm room window, out of the corner of your eye you caught sight of a bright red suit and a familiar looking mask.

“Y/N, let me in!” his voice was muffled by both the glass and the mask over his face. You stood and wiped your eyes before walking over to the window and sliding it open. Your spidey-suited friend, Peter, climbed his way through and landed not-so-gracefully on the floor. “Shit,” he muttered as his butt connected with the ugly carpet.

You stood over him for a second before returning to your bed. Peter stumbled back to his feet and pulled off his mask, his hair was messy and his face had a slight sheen that had been built up due to the stuffiness under the suit.

You felt the bed dip with his weight once he sat down next to you and you take another drink. And then another.

“Are you gonna talk to me or am I going to have to web that bottle to the other side of the room?” you cradled the bottle close to your chest and glared at him.

“You wouldn’t dare,” you slurred and squeezed it tighter against you. Peter rolled his eyes and you finally set it down. You pulled your legs up onto the bed and sat with your chin between your knees. “He,” you start to say between hiccups. “He dumped me.”

“What?” you could hear the shock in his voice. You leaned over and grabbed your still unlocked phone to give to him. Silence fell over the two of you as he read the lengthy paragraph. “I’ll always love you? What kind of shit is that?” you shrugged and took yet another drink, Peter sighed. “I’m sorry, Y/N.”

That fucking asshole.

You nodded, as tears started to form in your eyes again. There was a painful lump in your throat. “Thanks, Pete.”

You felt his arm snake around your shoulders and you allowed yourself to collapse into him, sad sniffs and sobs escaped your lips as the two of you sat in silence, his hand rubbing your shoulder comfortingly. You were so thankful for him.

Peter had to control himself. He wanted to get up and punch that asshole right in the face for hurting you. He knew you didn’t deserve that.

You and Peter became fast friends during your first year of college. You came to ESU from out of state and didn’t have any friends when you arrived, Peter’s situation was similar, except that he was the only one of his friends that decided to stay in-state. The two of you met on move-in day and from then on you stuck by each other.

Peter also never liked your ex. You met him during your second semester of freshman year and it didn’t take his spidey-senses to know that he was no good. But he didn’t say anything. You were happy, and Peter liked seeing you happy. Even though it killed him every time he saw you together.

“I’m going to beat the shit out of him,” Peter piped up, trying to lighten the mood. You laughed and sniffled.

“No you’re not,” you said.

“Yeah you’re right, he’ll probably just have an unfortunate fall down the stairs one day,” you laughed again. Happy that you were starting to smile, Peter continued with his list of “accidents” that could befall him. “Or, you know, his room will start to smell really bad because he somehow left a carton of milk out. Or he’ll lose his key and get locked out of his dorm because they somehow got stuck on the ceiling—”

You shoved him and wiped your nose with the back of your arm, a small smile still on your face. You collected yourself for a moment then made a pathetic attempt to stand up, which resulted in you almost toppling over. Peter stood up and caught you by the shoulders. You moaned in protest as he sat you back down.

“I want to get up…” you whined. Peter shook his head and leaned you against the wall. You hadn’t realized he had left to get you water until he was back and putting it in your hands. He had somehow managed to change out of his suit and into normal clothes without you even noticing. You gratefully accepted the water and chugged it— not realizing how thirsty you actually were.

It was an ungraceful act, and water had managed to trickle down your chin and onto your clothes. Peter stood next to the bed and watched as you started to lay down. You were ready to close your eyes and sleep, but as soon as your head touched the pillow you felt your stomach start to churn.

“Peter,” you started, but you couldn’t finish your sentence. The room was spinning and you knew you wouldn’t make it to the bathroom. Luckily, he was one step ahead of you. Peter, trash can at the ready, got there just in time. Your throat and stomach were hot as you proceeded to expel all of the toxins and food you’d consumed that day. You pulled back, your throat burning, cheeks hot with embarrassment, and felt your eyes well with tears again. “I’m sorry,” you said to him. “That’s so fucking gross, I’m sorry—”

You felt the rough surface of a paper towel on your chin as he cleaned you up. “Oh stop,” he said quietly. “You’ve stitched me up more times than I can count, the least I could do is help you through this,” that was true. Perks of being friends with a med student: they need to practice suturing. Something Peter needed a lot of.

You smiled again and took the towel from him to finish the job. A terrible taste lingered in your mouth.

“Can you, uh,” you pointed at your shower caddy. Peter grabbed your toothbrush and toothpaste, holding them out to you for confirmation. You nodded and he helped you to the bathroom. You gripped the edge of the sink tightly and Peter stood at the sink next to yours to wash his hands.

“Your guys’ bathroom is really clean,” he said once he’d finished. He pulled back one of the shower curtains. He had never been in the bathroom on the girl’s floors before, man he was jealous. “Not really what I expected but still, must be nice.”

You spat into the sink and looked at him. “What did you expect?” you asked.

“I dunno, like… maybe a guy handing you hot towels… or like the Ritz.”

“Oh shut up!” you laughed. Peter smiled and took your hand to lead you back to your room. You tried to untie your shoes but immediately regretted it as you bent over. “Here, I’ll do it,” he helped your shoes off and grabbed you some pajamas, which you took happily. He was always so nice to you.

Peter looked around awkwardly. “Should I, uh, go?” he asked. He knew the boundaries, but you didn’t want him to leave. Not yet.

“Just um…” you looked for somewhere he could go, but you were trapped in a tiny dorm, it’s not like he could just go to the other room. “Turn around okay? And promise not to look.”

He nodded and turned his back wordlessly. His head hung low, looking at his feet. You did the same. With your back to him, you began to get undressed— this should have felt awkward. You were best friends, something like seeing you naked could be a friendship-ender. But it wasn’t. It felt safe, intimate, you were way more comfortable doing this around Peter than you ever were with your ex.

You pushed those thoughts from your mind and turned back around. “Okay, I’m done.”

Peter lifted his head and faced you, a goofy smile came to his face once he saw the shirt you were wearing. “The Amazing Spider-Man, huh?”

“I thought you did that on purpose!” you laughed and looked down at the bright red, extra-long shirt. He’d grabbed you a pair of sleeping shorts and this t-shirt that you’d gotten way before you’d ever met him, before you’d known his secret.

“I just grabbed the first thing I saw! When did you get that?” you shrugged.

“Spider-Man has always been my favorite superhero,” Peter laughed and you glanced towards your bed, the desire for sleep growing ever stronger. You pulled back your duvet and climbed in. You heard the soft ‘thunk’ of him setting down the, thankfully now empty, trash can and pulled the covers up to your chin.

Your eyes grew heavier and heavier, and you were half asleep when you mumbled: “Peter,”

He turned around and saw that your eyes were closed. He was about to brush it off and head out the door when he heard you again.

“Please, stay,” your speech slurred thanks to the mix of alcohol and sleep. “At least until I fall asleep,” He looked at you for another minute before gently kicking off his shoes. He couldn’t say no to you. He sat down at the edge of your bed and you curled your body tighter to make more room for him. His hand rested gently on your calf over the sheets and he leaned his head against the wall.

“Of course, Y/N,” he said quietly as sleep began to tug at his eyes too.

+      +      +      +      +

You opened your eyes and were greeted by your too bright room. You’d forgotten to close your curtains so the sunlight was streaming in, which would have been nice had it not been for your splitting headache. You sat up slowly, bringing your legs in so that you were sitting criss-cross-applesauce, and stretched, the sound of soft breathing caught your attention. There was Peter, his head tilted back in a way that couldn’t be comfortable, his mouth slightly open, asleep against your wall.

He’d stayed the whole time.

You leaned over and shook his shoulder gently, which made him jump a little as he sat up. You watched as he rolled his neck, trying to stretch out the ache that had started right above his spine.

“Hey,” you said quietly. His hair was matted down in the back, his eyes were twisted shut, his skin basically glowing in the morning sun. You couldn’t deny…

“Hi,” he said back and opened one eye to look at you. Your hair was slightly messy, your cheeks were tinted pink, your lips were— unknowingly— parted ever so slightly. He couldn’t help it…

You wanted to kiss him so badly.
He wanted to kiss you so badly.

Your hand traveled down from his shoulder to his hand which had been planted on the surface of the bed. The two of you looked down and then back up at each other. The silence that permeated the room was heavy, and yet still comfortable. Everything unsaid, undone, hung in that silence. Slowly, you leaned forward, Peter did the same.

The kiss started out gentle, his soft lips barely pressing against yours, pulling away after a few seconds, testing the waters to make sure that this was okay. Then it deepened. He angled his body so that he could face you better, his weight resting on his knees, hands on your hips as he nipped gently at your bottom lip. The short, sharp sensation followed by the softness of his tongue made you whimper. Your hands flew around his neck and up into his hair as you uncrossed your legs.

He pushed himself closer to you, your legs on either side of his as the kiss deepened again. Tongue, teeth, and morning breath (which the two of you ignored as you were too caught up in other things.) You began to lay back slowly and pulled him down with you. His body on top of yours made you gasp again and it was your turn to take a bite of him. A low growl escaped his throat, a noise you never thought Peter Parker could make, and he moved from your lips to your jaw. Your hands gripped his back as he gently kissed down your neck.

“Is this,” he started, his lips hovering over the shell of your ear. “Is this okay?” you nodded.

“Yes, it’s great— Peter!” his name came out in a moan as he sucked at the base of your jaw. “Oh…” you gasped. You had no idea that was a sweet spot for you. Your ex had never paid attention to how your body responded. You tugged at his hair as he continued to lick and bite around your neck, making sure not to stay in one spot for too long so that he didn’t leave a massive mark.

Somehow, you flipped him over. You straddled him as you brought your lips back down to his, and he happily parted them for you. You decided to follow what he’d just done to you and kissed down his neck, biting and sucking until you heard him let out another deep growl. You lingered there, just above his collar bone.

“F—fuck!” he whined. One hand made its way under the red fabric of your shirt and rested on the bare skin of your waist. “Y/N, oh my god.”

You looked up at him, his lips were pink and swollen as he let out a few faint gasps, his hair was starting to stick to his forehead. You loved seeing him like this, you wanted this to last forever. But something stopped you. You felt a slight pain, not physical, when you thought about the idea of going further.

You kissed back up to his lips and gave him one final peck before sitting up, guilt suddenly flowed through you. Peter sat up too, laying his weight on his elbows as you were still on top of him— which he didn’t mind.

“Are you okay?” he asked once he noticed you had looked down at your hands.

“I um, I don’t think I can… you know ‘go all the way.’ not right now at least,” Peter cocked his head to the side. “I’m sorry if that’s what you wanted… I’m sorry if I made you think that—” he reached up to cup your cheek, the soft pad of his thumb ran gently over your skin.

“Whatever you want, Y/N,” he said. “I’m okay with,” he had a small smile on his face.

“You’re not… upset?”

“Of course not! This,” he said and gestured at you. “Is enough.”

You smiled back at him and leaned down to kiss him one more time— softer than before, your hand cradled his cheek. You pulled away and rested your forehead on his, this closeness you felt with Peter had been completely foreign until now. And you knew that you wouldn’t feel it with anyone else.

You heard your phone chime and picked it up. It was a snap from your ex, against your better judgment you opened it. He had his arm wrapped around a blonde girl that you’d never seen before, cheesy grins on both of their faces.

‘Streaks!!🔥🔥 Party tonight in N-building! Second floor!!!!!’ it read. You grimaced. Peter got the same notification.

“What a dick,” he said. You shrugged and tossed your phone back on the bed before standing. Peter glanced at you and sucked in a sharp breath. “Shit! Sorry!”

“What?” he tapped his neck and you looked at yourself in your mirror. Right below your jaw, a purple mark started to bloom.

“I thought I was being careful,” he said shyly. You laughed and made your way over to him. You pulled down the collar of his shirt and saw his own deep hickey.

“It’s okay, we’re even,” you winked. Peter watched as you opened your closet to find something to wear. That asshole had no idea what he was missing with you. Peter wanted him to know it.

“Let’s go.”

“What?”

“To his party. Let’s go!” you shook your head at him.

“You’re high.”

“No, I’m serious! He deserves to see what he’s missing. And it’ll really piss him off to see that,” he said and pointed at your neck. “Especially if he knows it was left by me.”

You shrugged and he stood up to make his way over to you. His chin rested on your shoulder, arms around your waist. Your heart fluttered, he just made you feel so goddamn warm.

“C’mon, Y/N. Let’s stir some shit up.”

You giggled at that and turned to face him, still in his grasp. “Alright,” you said, wrapping your arms around his neck. “I’m in.”

“To his party. Let’s go!” you shook your head at him.

“You’re high.”

“No, I’m serious! He deserves to see what he’s missing. And it’ll really piss him off to see that,” he said and pointed at your neck. “Especially if he knows it was left by me.”

You shrugged and he stood up to make his way over to you. His chin rested on your shoulder, arms around your waist. Your heart fluttered, he just made you feel so goddamn warm.

“C’mon, Y/N. Let’s stir some shit up.”

You giggled at that and turned to face him, still in his grasp. “Alright,” you said, wrapping your arms around his neck. “I’m in.”
