summary: you’d just gotten dumped and had been wallowing in it for what was probably way too long. good thing there was peter.

pairing: college!peter parker x reader

warnings: language, angst, kissing ;)

word count: 3k

a/n: i’m so fucking proud of this!! this is probably my favorite thing i’ve ever written on this blog, so i hope you guys like it!! (also i might be starting to write smut sometime in the not too distant future…..) okay bye!!

It was two in the morning. You were still awake… and very drunk. Very drunk— which is never a good state for you to be in. But that’s what happens when you’re left alone, sad, on a Friday evening. Your roommate’s family lived close to the ESU campus, so she’d often go home for the weekend, most of your friends were home this weekend, but not you. You’d rather cry yourself to sleep while drinking your secret stash of booze than go home right now.

Just hours previous to that very moment, you’d gotten dumped. Via text. Why did it have to be text? This isn’t high school, you were adults in college for christ’s sake! Your now ex-boyfriend constructed a long and drawn out paragraph, spelling out how he’d “been seeing someone else for a month,” and how he “didn’t love you anymore,” and that he “wished you the best and would always have love in his heart for you.”

Hypocrite.

You’d finished reading the text over again, the now three-quarters full bottle sitting precariously on your chest, and threw your phone against the uncomfortable twin mattress. You hated that you were wallowing in it, you hated that he made you cry, you hated that you felt like you didn’t know what to do without him— boys shouldn’t make you feel like that. You pushed yourself into more of a sitting position and lifted the bottle to your mouth, the room temperature alcohol slid down your throat and warmed your stomach. At least that was helping.

You jumped at the sound of knocking at your dorm room window, out of the corner of your eye you caught sight of a bright red suit and a familiar looking mask.

“Y/N, let me in!” his voice was muffled by both the glass and the mask over his face. You stood and wiped your eyes before walking over to the window and sliding it open. Your spidey-suited friend, Peter, climbed his way through and landed not-so-gracefully on the floor. “Shit,” he muttered as his butt connected with the ugly carpet.

You stood over him for a second before returning to your bed. Peter stumbled back to his feet and pulled off his mask, his hair was messy and his face had a slight sheen that had been built up due to the stuffiness under the suit.

You felt the bed dip with his weight once he sat down next to you and you take another drink. And then another.

“Are you gonna talk to me or am I going to have to web that bottle to the other side of the room?” you cradled the bottle close to your chest and glared at him.

“You wouldn’t dare,” you slurred and squeezed it tighter against you. Peter rolled his eyes and you finally set it down. You pulled your legs up onto the bed and sat with your chin between your knees. “He,” you start to say between hiccups. “He dumped me.”

“What?” you could hear the shock in his voice. You leaned over and grabbed your still unlocked phone to give to him. Silence fell over the two of you as he read the lengthy paragraph. “I’ll always love you? What kind of shit is that?” you shrugged and took yet another drink, Peter sighed. “I’m sorry, Y/N.”

That fucking asshole.

You nodded, as tears started to form in your eyes again. There was a painful lump in your throat. “Thanks, Pete.”

You felt his arm snake around your shoulders and you allowed yourself to collapse into him, sad sniffs and sobs escaped your lips as the two of you sat in silence, his hand rubbing your shoulder comfortingly. You were so thankful for him.

Peter had to control himself. He wanted to get up and punch that asshole right in the face for hurting you. He knew you didn’t deserve that.

You and Peter became fast friends during your first year of college. You came to ESU from out of state and didn’t have any friends when you arrived, Peter’s situation was similar, except that he was the only one of his friends that decided to stay in-state. The two of you met on move-in day and from then on you stuck by each other.

Peter also never liked your ex. You met him during your second semester of freshman year and it didn’t take his spidey-senses to know that he was no good. But he didn’t say anything. You were happy, and Peter liked seeing you happy. Even though it killed him every time he saw you together.

“I’m going to beat the shit out of him,” Peter piped up, trying to lighten the mood. You laughed and sniffled.

“No you’re not,” you said.

“Yeah you’re right, he’ll probably just have an unfortunate fall down the stairs one day,” you laughed again. Happy that you were starting to smile, Peter continued with his list of “accidents” that could befall him. “Or, you know, his room will start to smell really bad because he somehow left a carton of milk out. Or he’ll lose his key and get locked out of his dorm because they somehow got stuck on the ceiling—”

You shoved him and wiped your nose with the back of your arm, a small smile still on your face. You collected yourself for a moment then made a pathetic attempt to stand up, which resulted in you almost toppling over. Peter stood up and caught you by the shoulders. You moaned in protest as he sat you back down.

“I want to get up…” you whined. Peter shook his head and leaned you against the wall. You hadn’t realized he had left to get you water until he was back and putting it in your hands. He had somehow managed to change out of his suit and into normal clothes without you even noticing. You gratefully accepted the water and chugged it— not realizing how thirsty you actually were.

It was an ungraceful act, and water had managed to trickle down your chin and onto your clothes. Peter stood next to the bed and watched as you started to lay down. You were ready to close your eyes and sleep, but as soon as your head touched the pillow you felt your stomach start to churn.

“Peter,” you started, but you couldn’t finish your sentence. The room was spinning and you knew you wouldn’t make it to the bathroom. Luckily, he was one step ahead of you. Peter, trash can at the ready, got there just in time. Your throat and stomach were hot as you proceeded to expel all of the toxins and food you’d consumed that day. You pulled back, your throat burning, cheeks hot with embarrassment, and felt your eyes well with tears again. “I’m sorry,” you said to him. “That’s so fucking gross, I’m sorry—”

You felt the rough surface of a paper towel on your chin as he cleaned you up. “Oh stop,” he said quietly. “You’ve stitched me up more times than I can count, the least I could do is help you through this,” that was true. Perks of being friends with a med student: they need to practice suturing. Something Peter needed a lot of.

You smiled again and took the towel from him to finish the job. A terrible taste lingered in your mouth.

“Can you, uh,” you pointed at your shower caddy. Peter grabbed your toothbrush and toothpaste, holding them out to you for confirmation. You nodded and he helped you to the bathroom. You gripped the edge of the sink tightly and Peter stood at the sink next to yours to wash his hands.

“Your guys’ bathroom is really clean,” he said once he’d finished. He pulled back one of the shower curtains. He had never been in the bathroom on the girl’s floors before, man he was jealous. “Not really what I expected but still, must be nice.”

You spat into the sink and looked at him. “What did you expect?” you asked.

“I dunno, like… maybe a guy handing you hot towels… or like the Ritz.”

“Oh shut up!” you laughed. Peter smiled and took your hand to lead you back to your room. You tried to untie your shoes but immediately regretted it as you bent over. “Here, I’ll do it,” he helped your shoes off and grabbed you some pajamas, which you took happily. He was always so nice to you.

Peter looked around awkwardly. “Should I, uh, go?” he asked. He knew the boundaries, but you didn’t want him to leave. Not yet.

“Just um…” you looked for somewhere he could go, but you were trapped in a tiny dorm, it’s not like he could just go to the other room. “Turn around okay? And promise not to look.”

He nodded and turned his back wordlessly. His head hung low, looking at his feet. You did the same. With your back to him, you began to get undressed— this should have felt awkward. You were best friends, something like seeing you naked could be a friendship-ender. But it wasn’t. It felt safe, intimate, you were way more comfortable doing this around Peter than you ever were with your ex.

You pushed those thoughts from your mind and turned back around. “Okay, I’m done.”

Peter lifted his head and faced you, a goofy smile came to his face once he saw the shirt you were wearing. “The Amazing Spider-Man, huh?”

“I thought you did that on purpose!” you laughed and looked down at the bright red, extra-long shirt. He’d grabbed you a pair of sleeping shorts and this t-shirt that you’d gotten way before you’d ever met him, before you’d known his secret.

“I just grabbed the first thing I saw! When did you get that?” you shrugged.

“Spider-Man has always been my favorite superhero,” Peter laughed and you glanced towards your bed, the desire for sleep growing ever stronger. You pulled back your duvet and climbed in. You heard the soft ‘thunk’ of him setting down the, thankfully now empty, trash can and pulled the covers up to your chin.

Your eyes grew heavier and heavier, and you were half asleep when you mumbled: “Peter,”

He turned around and saw that your eyes were closed. He was about to brush it off and head out the door when he heard you again.

“Please, stay,” your speech slurred thanks to the mix of alcohol and sleep. “At least until I fall asleep,” He looked at you for another minute before gently kicking off his shoes. He couldn’t say no to you. He sat down at the edge of your bed and you curled your body tighter to make more room for him. His hand rested gently on your calf over the sheets and he leaned his head against the wall.

“Of course, Y/N,” he said quietly as sleep began to tug at his eyes too.

+      +      +      +      +

You opened your eyes and were greeted by your too bright room. You’d forgotten to close your curtains so the sunlight was streaming in, which would have been nice had it not been for your splitting headache. You sat up slowly, bringing your legs in so that you were sitting criss-cross-applesauce, and stretched, the sound of soft breathing caught your attention. There was Peter, his head tilted back in a way that couldn’t be comfortable, his mouth slightly open, asleep against your wall.

He’d stayed the whole time.

You leaned over and shook his shoulder gently, which made him jump a little as he sat up. You watched as he rolled his neck, trying to stretch out the ache that had started right above his spine.

“Hey,” you said quietly. His hair was matted down in the back, his eyes were twisted shut, his skin basically glowing in the morning sun. You couldn’t deny…

“Hi,” he said back and opened one eye to look at you. Your hair was slightly messy, your cheeks were tinted pink, your lips were— unknowingly— parted ever so slightly. He couldn’t help it…

You wanted to kiss him so badly.
He wanted to kiss you so badly.

Your hand traveled down from his shoulder to his hand which had been planted on the surface of the bed. The two of you looked down and then back up at each other. The silence that permeated the room was heavy, and yet still comfortable. Everything unsaid, undone, hung in that silence. Slowly, you leaned forward, Peter did the same.

The kiss started out gentle, his soft lips barely pressing against yours, pulling away after a few seconds, testing the waters to make sure that this was okay. Then it deepened. He angled his body so that he could face you better, his weight resting on his knees, hands on your hips as he nipped gently at your bottom lip. The short, sharp sensation followed by the softness of his tongue made you whimper. Your hands flew around his neck and up into his hair as you uncrossed your legs.

He pushed himself closer to you, your legs on either side of his as the kiss deepened again. Tongue, teeth, and morning breath (which the two of you ignored as you were too caught up in other things.) You began to lay back slowly and pulled him down with you. His body on top of yours made you gasp again and it was your turn to take a bite of him. A low growl escaped his throat, a noise you never thought Peter Parker could make, and he moved from your lips to your jaw. Your hands gripped his back as he gently kissed down your neck.

“Is this,” he started, his lips hovering over the shell of your ear. “Is this okay?” you nodded.

“Yes, it’s great— Peter!” his name came out in a moan as he sucked at the base of your jaw. “Oh…” you gasped. You had no idea that was a sweet spot for you. Your ex had never paid attention to how your body responded. You tugged at his hair as he continued to lick and bite around your neck, making sure not to stay in one spot for too long so that he didn’t leave a massive mark.

Somehow, you flipped him over. You straddled him as you brought your lips back down to his, and he happily parted them for you. You decided to follow what he’d just done to you and kissed down his neck, biting and sucking until you heard him let out another deep growl. You lingered there, just above his collar bone.

“F—fuck!” he whined. One hand made its way under the red fabric of your shirt and rested on the bare skin of your waist. “Y/N, oh my god.”

You looked up at him, his lips were pink and swollen as he let out a few faint gasps, his hair was starting to stick to his forehead. You loved seeing him like this, you wanted this to last forever. But something stopped you. You felt a slight pain, not physical, when you thought about the idea of going further.

You kissed back up to his lips and gave him one final peck before sitting up, guilt suddenly flowed through you. Peter sat up too, laying his weight on his elbows as you were still on top of him— which he didn’t mind.

“Are you okay?” he asked once he noticed you had looked down at your hands.

“I um, I don’t think I can… you know ‘go all the way.’ not right now at least,” Peter cocked his head to the side. “I’m sorry if that’s what you wanted… I’m sorry if I made you think that—” he reached up to cup your cheek, the soft pad of his thumb ran gently over your skin.

“Whatever you want, Y/N,” he said. “I’m okay with,” he had a small smile on his face.

“You’re not… upset?”

“Of course not! This,” he said and gestured at you. “Is enough.”

You smiled back at him and leaned down to kiss him one more time— softer than before, your hand cradled his cheek. You pulled away and rested your forehead on his, this closeness you felt with Peter had been completely foreign until now. And you knew that you wouldn’t feel it with anyone else.

You heard your phone chime and picked it up. It was a snap from your ex, against your better judgment you opened it. He had his arm wrapped around a blonde girl that you’d never seen before, cheesy grins on both of their faces.

‘Streaks!!🔥🔥 Party tonight in N-building! Second floor!!!!!’ it read. You grimaced. Peter got the same notification.

“What a dick,” he said. You shrugged and tossed your phone back on the bed before standing. Peter glanced at you and sucked in a sharp breath. “Shit! Sorry!”

“What?” he tapped his neck and you looked at yourself in your mirror. Right below your jaw, a purple mark started to bloom.

“I thought I was being careful,” he said shyly. You laughed and made your way over to him. You pulled down the collar of his shirt and saw his own deep hickey.

“It’s okay, we’re even,” you winked. Peter watched as you opened your closet to find something to wear. That asshole had no idea what he was missing with you. Peter wanted him to know it.

“Let’s go.”

“What?”

“To his party. Let’s go!” you shook your head at him.

“You’re high.”

“No, I’m serious! He deserves to see what he’s missing. And it’ll really piss him off to see that,” he said and pointed at your neck. “Especially if he knows it was left by me.”

You shrugged and he stood up to make his way over to you. His chin rested on your shoulder, arms around your waist. Your heart fluttered, he just made you feel so goddamn warm.

“C’mon, Y/N. Let’s stir some shit up.”

You giggled at that and turned to face him, still in his grasp. “Alright,” you said, wrapping your arms around his neck. “I’m in.”

summary: Lockscreen Tells All
title: Lockscreen Tells All
body:
Summary: Peter gets a glimpse of how you see him through the lens and it opens up how you both truly feel. 

Pairing: Peter Parker x Reader

This is a part of @blissfulparker‘s writing challenge to celebrate 5k! 

The bell rang and the class around you transformed from dutiful students to heathens fighting to get out the door first. Patiently, you and your best friend MJ waited for the rest of your classmates to leave before gathering your belongings.

“Are you still cool with sleeping over this weekend, Y/N?” MJ asked as you two walked up to your side-by-side lockers.

“Absolutely! I’ve been so busy lately. It’s like all of the school events happen in the last month of school. Principal Morita has had me booked solid taking pictures.” You were shoving books in your locker aimlessly as tiredness was settling in your bones.

MJ slammed her locker and looked at you with excitement. “Well we’re not going to worry about that this weekend. We’re going to stock up on junk food, the guys are going to come over, and forget all about anything school related!”

Your heart picked up slightly at the thought of seeing Peter tonight. You hadn’t seen him all day so it made you even more excited. But you kept your face devoid of emotion in order to keep your crush on Peter Parker to yourself. You hadn’t told MJ and you weren’t planning on letting it slip in the school hallway.

MJ didn’t seem to notice your change in demeanor, instead she snatched your hand and shook it, squealing with you for a minute. Then she stopped and looked around, making sure no one had seen her. You giggled energetically and tangled your arm with hers.

“Let’s go, you dork!”

~~~

The windows were wide open to let the breeze flow through the room and MJ had the music cranked to an ungodly level. The two of you had changed into your pajamas and were dancing around the room, a thin layer of sweat on your skin.

It felt amazing to escape the strain of your current lifestyle even for just a few hours. MJ had forced you to promise that you wouldn’t use your camera for anything professional for the whole weekend and it hadn’t taken much to accept that stipulation.

Knock knock. MJ was lost in the music so you swayed your way to the front door, half expecting the pizza delivery boy. You swung the door open and froze in your spot as you came face to face with chocolate brown eyes, messy curls, and perfectly pouty lips. He looked adorable in a Stark Industries t-shirt that fit him wonderfully.

Instinctively, you reached up to tame your hair that had tangled into a hornets nest during your dance session. It was evident that it was a lost cause so you diverted to straightening your tank top and shorts instead.

Peter watched you with fascination and your stomach was erupting with butterflies as his gaze traveled along your face. Ned kept looking back and forth between the two of you, unaware of what was going on.

“Hi, Y/N. What have you and MJ been up too?” Ned broke in at last.

You turned your focus to Ned, remembering that he was here too. “Hey, Ned. Um, just been listening to some music while we waited for the pizza.” You gave Peter a small smile. “I got extra pepperoni for you.” 

“Ah, awesome! Thanks, Y/N/N, you’re the best.” Peter exclaimed and you beamed from being praised.

The boys crowded their way into the living room and plopped down onto the couch in their usual places. Trying to act as casual as possible, you sank into the place right next to Peter and tucked your feet under you. It was impossible to ignore that his hand was just inches from your knee. One little bump and his long fingers could be on your skin.

“What movie do you guys want to start with?” MJ asked from the floor, her body turned just enough to acknowledge the group.

Ned bounced slightly, “Let’s watch a scary movie!”

The rest of the group agreed easily but you groaned loudly. “Not another scary movie, you guys. I’ll be up all night.”

Peter leaned over, his shoulder bumping into yours. You were hyper-sensitive to the feeling of his shoulder against yours. “I promise I won’t let anything get you. You can hold my hand if you get scared.”

Goosebumps speckled your skin in an instant. He was watching you with that comforting gaze that always made you feel protected. You slowly nodded and his eyes glistened with delight. You bit your lip nervously, dying to press your mouth to his, instead you fell backwards against the fluffy pillow beside you.

Another knock at the door interrupted the chatter and MJ jumped up to answer it.

“Someone get the drinks, I’ll get the pizza.” She called as she ran out of the room. You moved to get up at the same time as Peter.

“I’ll help you get everything.” He offered when you gave him a weird look. A small flutter went through your body as he motioned for you to lead the way.

Your head was buried in the fridge when you recognized the faint tune of your cell alarm. You glanced around to see it lying on the kitchen counter.

“Can you get that, Pete? It’s probably just my alarm.” And you returned to pulling out different sodas from the rack.

“Sure, no problem…” His voice trailed off.

Silence hung over the room like a blanket and you looked up to find him staring at your phone screen. “Um, are you okay? Pete?”

“Am I your lockscreen?”

You swallowed thickly. It had completely slipped your mind that you had made him your lock screen a few weeks ago. You had been on your way to take pictures for the Robotics Competition when you had seen him in the hallway talking to a classmate. He just looked so happy and free that you couldn’t stop yourself from capturing the moment.

Now, he was standing in front of you, barely more than a step away, waiting for an answer. You wondered if he could hear the blood rushing in your ears or the thudding of your heart inside your chest.

“Um. Well, yes. I just love the picture and I like to have things I like for my wallpaper…” Your feet had suddenly become more interesting to you in the last 15 seconds.

“And you like me?” His voice was soft.

All you could do was nod like a child who was scared to be scolded.

You were surprised by a hand tilting your chin up, and you lifted your eyes to meet his. Shivers were running down your spine as Peter smiled sweetly down at you. He leaned forward, his nose brushing against yours, and your breath was caught in your throat. Was this really happening?

He hesitated in that spot, “I like you too.” Lips rubbing against each other as he said the words.

You lost all sensibility in that moment. You wrapped your arms around his neck and pulled him the rest of the way. He made a little oof of surprise and placed his hands on your waist instantaneously.

You and Peter were pushing and pulling against each other like fuel to a fire. His hands were pressed to the low spot of your back and you were playing with the small curls at the base of his neck. His lips felt calming and electric as they moved against yours.

Peter had turned and pinned you against the counter, deepening the kiss, and the thumping of his heart was echoing in your chest. His body was flush against yours and the heat was rushing to your head. The primal instinct within you was dying to keep going, unrelenting to let Peter out of your grasp. But the practical side of you was telling you that this was only your first kiss. The first of many, you hoped.

The need for air overtook the need for passion and you broke away. Peter was panting heavily, his breath washing over you. Without thinking, you stood on your tiptoes and pulled his lower lip in between your teeth and then let it snap back. Peter groaned and rested his forehead against yours.

“You are so beautiful. God, I could kiss you all night.” The words were husky with adoration.

You giggled like a schoolgirl and rubbed your nose against his. “I think MJ and Ned might think something was up.”

Peter’s eyes flicked to the doorway and laughed an airy laugh. “I think they may already know.”

You turned your head quickly to see MJ and Ned standing in the doorway, knowing smirks on their face. A blush tipped your cheeks and you tucked in closer to Peter’s body, your cheek placed against his neck.

“You owe me five bucks, Ned.” MJ held her hand and Ned grumbled as he dug around in his pockets.

“Ah man, you two couldn’t have waited two more weeks. I needed that.” Ned hung his head and headed back into the living room. MJ shot you an annoyingly smug grin and disappeared to follow Ned.

Peter squeezed his arms around you and you melted into his touch. “Ya know, I really like that picture you took of me. You’re so freakin talented.”

You smiled against his neck. “Thanks, Pete. But it’s just a hobby, nothing special.”

“Trust me when I say, everything about you is special. And I hope I’m allowed to show you every day just how special you are to me.” He looked down at you, his chocolate brown were tinted with want. You could tell that he was nervous to be this open with someone.

You bent forward and kissed his lips sweetly. “Only if I get to do the same thing for you, Peter Parker.”

Peter embraced you tightly and lifted you off your feet and you could feel his face pressed into your hair. Your heart was soaring with excitement. The last thing you had expected from this weekend was catching the guy you’d been pining after for so long. It was an amazing feeling.

Finally, Peter reluctantly put you down but held your hand up against his heart. “I’ll be your lockscreen for as long as you’ll have me.”

“COME ON, YOU LOVEBIRDS.” You both burst out laughing as MJ screamed from the living room, snapping you out of your trance. You locked your hand with Peter and started gathering the sodas for your friends.

“You promised I could hold your hand if I got scared, right?” You quipped and Peter’s grin told you all you needed to know.

Pairing: Peter Parker x Reader

This is a part of @blissfulparker‘s writing challenge to celebrate 5k! 

The bell rang and the class around you transformed from dutiful students to heathens fighting to get out the door first. Patiently, you and your best friend MJ waited for the rest of your classmates to leave before gathering your belongings.

“Are you still cool with sleeping over this weekend, Y/N?” MJ asked as you two walked up to your side-by-side lockers.

“Absolutely! I’ve been so busy lately. It’s like all of the school events happen in the last month of school. Principal Morita has had me booked solid taking pictures.” You were shoving books in your locker aimlessly as tiredness was settling in your bones.

[[MORE]]

MJ slammed her locker and looked at you with excitement. “Well we’re not going to worry about that this weekend. We’re going to stock up on junk food, the guys are going to come over, and forget all about anything school related!”

Your heart picked up slightly at the thought of seeing Peter tonight. You hadn’t seen him all day so it made you even more excited. But you kept your face devoid of emotion in order to keep your crush on Peter Parker to yourself. You hadn’t told MJ and you weren’t planning on letting it slip in the school hallway.

MJ didn’t seem to notice your change in demeanor, instead she snatched your hand and shook it, squealing with you for a minute. Then she stopped and looked around, making sure no one had seen her. You giggled energetically and tangled your arm with hers.

“Let’s go, you dork!”

~~~

The windows were wide open to let the breeze flow through the room and MJ had the music cranked to an ungodly level. The two of you had changed into your pajamas and were dancing around the room, a thin layer of sweat on your skin.

It felt amazing to escape the strain of your current lifestyle even for just a few hours. MJ had forced you to promise that you wouldn’t use your camera for anything professional for the whole weekend and it hadn’t taken much to accept that stipulation.

Knock knock. MJ was lost in the music so you swayed your way to the front door, half expecting the pizza delivery boy. You swung the door open and froze in your spot as you came face to face with chocolate brown eyes, messy curls, and perfectly pouty lips. He looked adorable in a Stark Industries t-shirt that fit him wonderfully.

Instinctively, you reached up to tame your hair that had tangled into a hornets nest during your dance session. It was evident that it was a lost cause so you diverted to straightening your tank top and shorts instead.

Peter watched you with fascination and your stomach was erupting with butterflies as his gaze traveled along your face. Ned kept looking back and forth between the two of you, unaware of what was going on.

“Hi, Y/N. What have you and MJ been up too?” Ned broke in at last.

You turned your focus to Ned, remembering that he was here too. “Hey, Ned. Um, just been listening to some music while we waited for the pizza.” You gave Peter a small smile. “I got extra pepperoni for you.” 

“Ah, awesome! Thanks, Y/N/N, you’re the best.” Peter exclaimed and you beamed from being praised.

The boys crowded their way into the living room and plopped down onto the couch in their usual places. Trying to act as casual as possible, you sank into the place right next to Peter and tucked your feet under you. It was impossible to ignore that his hand was just inches from your knee. One little bump and his long fingers could be on your skin.

“What movie do you guys want to start with?” MJ asked from the floor, her body turned just enough to acknowledge the group.

Ned bounced slightly, “Let’s watch a scary movie!”

The rest of the group agreed easily but you groaned loudly. “Not another scary movie, you guys. I’ll be up all night.”

Peter leaned over, his shoulder bumping into yours. You were hyper-sensitive to the feeling of his shoulder against yours. “I promise I won’t let anything get you. You can hold my hand if you get scared.”

Goosebumps speckled your skin in an instant. He was watching you with that comforting gaze that always made you feel protected. You slowly nodded and his eyes glistened with delight. You bit your lip nervously, dying to press your mouth to his, instead you fell backwards against the fluffy pillow beside you.

Another knock at the door interrupted the chatter and MJ jumped up to answer it.

“Someone get the drinks, I’ll get the pizza.” She called as she ran out of the room. You moved to get up at the same time as Peter.

“I’ll help you get everything.” He offered when you gave him a weird look. A small flutter went through your body as he motioned for you to lead the way.

Your head was buried in the fridge when you recognized the faint tune of your cell alarm. You glanced around to see it lying on the kitchen counter.

“Can you get that, Pete? It’s probably just my alarm.” And you returned to pulling out different sodas from the rack.

“Sure, no problem…” His voice trailed off.

Silence hung over the room like a blanket and you looked up to find him staring at your phone screen. “Um, are you okay? Pete?”

“Am I your lockscreen?”

You swallowed thickly. It had completely slipped your mind that you had made him your lock screen a few weeks ago. You had been on your way to take pictures for the Robotics Competition when you had seen him in the hallway talking to a classmate. He just looked so happy and free that you couldn’t stop yourself from capturing the moment.

Now, he was standing in front of you, barely more than a step away, waiting for an answer. You wondered if he could hear the blood rushing in your ears or the thudding of your heart inside your chest.

“Um. Well, yes. I just love the picture and I like to have things I like for my wallpaper…” Your feet had suddenly become more interesting to you in the last 15 seconds.

“And you like me?” His voice was soft.

All you could do was nod like a child who was scared to be scolded.

You were surprised by a hand tilting your chin up, and you lifted your eyes to meet his. Shivers were running down your spine as Peter smiled sweetly down at you. He leaned forward, his nose brushing against yours, and your breath was caught in your throat. Was this really happening?

He hesitated in that spot, “I like you too.” Lips rubbing against each other as he said the words.

You lost all sensibility in that moment. You wrapped your arms around his neck and pulled him the rest of the way. He made a little oof of surprise and placed his hands on your waist instantaneously.

You and Peter were pushing and pulling against each other like fuel to a fire. His hands were pressed to the low spot of your back and you were playing with the small curls at the base of his neck. His lips felt calming and electric as they moved against yours.

Peter had turned and pinned you against the counter, deepening the kiss, and the thumping of his heart was echoing in your chest. His body was flush against yours and the heat was rushing to your head. The primal instinct within you was dying to keep going, unrelenting to let Peter out of your grasp. But the practical side of you was telling you that this was only your first kiss. The first of many, you hoped.

The need for air overtook the need for passion and you broke away. Peter was panting heavily, his breath washing over you. Without thinking, you stood on your tiptoes and pulled his lower lip in between your teeth and then let it snap back. Peter groaned and rested his forehead against yours.

“You are so beautiful. God, I could kiss you all night.” The words were husky with adoration.

You giggled like a schoolgirl and rubbed your nose against his. “I think MJ and Ned might think something was up.”

Peter’s eyes flicked to the doorway and laughed an airy laugh. “I think they may already know.”

You turned your head quickly to see MJ and Ned standing in the doorway, knowing smirks on their face. A blush tipped your cheeks and you tucked in closer to Peter’s body, your cheek placed against his neck.

“You owe me five bucks, Ned.” MJ held her hand and Ned grumbled as he dug around in his pockets.

“Ah man, you two couldn’t have waited two more weeks. I needed that.” Ned hung his head and headed back into the living room. MJ shot you an annoyingly smug grin and disappeared to follow Ned.

Peter squeezed his arms around you and you melted into his touch. “Ya know, I really like that picture you took of me. You’re so freakin talented.”

You smiled against his neck. “Thanks, Pete. But it’s just a hobby, nothing special.”

“Trust me when I say, everything about you is special. And I hope I’m allowed to show you every day just how special you are to me.” He looked down at you, his chocolate brown were tinted with want. You could tell that he was nervous to be this open with someone.

You bent forward and kissed his lips sweetly. “Only if I get to do the same thing for you, Peter Parker.”

Peter embraced you tightly and lifted you off your feet and you could feel his face pressed into your hair. Your heart was soaring with excitement. The last thing you had expected from this weekend was catching the guy you’d been pining after for so long. It was an amazing feeling.

Finally, Peter reluctantly put you down but held your hand up against his heart. “I’ll be your lockscreen for as long as you’ll have me.”

“COME ON, YOU LOVEBIRDS.” You both burst out laughing as MJ screamed from the living room, snapping you out of your trance. You locked your hand with Peter and started gathering the sodas for your friends.

“You promised I could hold your hand if I got scared, right?” You quipped and Peter’s grin told you all you needed to know.

blog.title: Welcome to the Trash Heap™! Enjoy your stay
blog.description: You can call me Nightie, and I'm a uni student who uses writing as a means to procrastinate. Requests are open!! ~masterlist~

summary: Creepy Crawlies-- Peter Parker x Reader
title: Creepy Crawlies-- Peter Parker x Reader
body:
Prompt; none!

Warnings; language

Word Count 1.2k

Notes; no spoilers for any Marvel movies :)

You bounced on the balls of your feet, excited for a chance to get out of the busy city. The school had arranged a camping trip for your grade. They were shipping everyone upstate to learn about nature conservation or whatever. You couldn’t wait.

The bus was chaotic, but that was nothing new. As with any bus, there were certain sections that stereotyped a person. The hooligans sat in the back and seemed to be putting on a circus. Meanwhile, the ~quirky~ crowd sat up front. Everyone knows the ones I’m talking about, every school has them. The sweet spot, you discovered, was somewhere in the middle but close enough to the front to avoid mysterious projectiles from the back. That’s where you and your friends sat.

You had met Peter in freshman year, when you two were assigned as lab partners. You just couldn’t help not being friends with him. It didn’t take long for feelings to evolve. True, he was good looking. You would be one of the first to admit that. But it was his personality that really did you in. He was too bubbly and kindhearted to avoid. You loved the way his eyes lit up when he had an idea, and how he didn’t think he was too cool to build with Legos, and…

Wait, why am I still rambling about this?

It’s your crush. You know why you like him.

Anyways, back to the story.

“Hello? Earth to Y/N?” You blinked, realizing that Peter was waving a hand in front of your face. You gave him a sheepish grin.

“Sorry, zoned out again. What were you saying?” Peter raised a brow at you.

“Ned was trying to bribe me into eating a bug when we get there. You’ve been zoning out a lot lately.” Ned leaned over, a shit-eating grin plastered across his face.

“Yeah, I wonder why.” Your face reddened. Ned found out about your not-so-little crush last summer. It’s no surprise, considering you weren’t exactly subtle about it. It’s a wonder that Peter hadn’t caught on.

“Just tired, I guess. Didn’t drink any coffee this morning,” you quickly explained. Peter nodded and went back to talking about how he was not going to be eating bugs. You glared at Ned, who just laughed at you.

You were beyond ecstatic when the bus stopped. As you grabbed your bag and followed the conga-line out, you complained that your legs felt like jello from sitting so long. The teachers herded everyone onto the camping grounds and handed out the tents. For a school full of geniuses, you’d think setting up a tent would be fairly simple.

Apparently not.

It was nearly dark by the time everyone was finished, so, instead of going on the hike the original itinerary included, everyone settled on having a bonfire and roasting marshmallows.

As it turns out, Peter is absolutely useless when it comes to roasting a marshmallow. He either turns it into a fireball or drops it in the dirt on accident. Being the wilderness extraordinaire that you are, you offered to make a couple of s’mores for him. You went to hand him the chocolatey-gooey-goodness, but he just stared at you with wide eyes.

“Y/N, don’t freak out. There’s a giant spider on your shoulder.” You froze, slowly looking towards your shoulder.

“Oh my god. Where?”

“It just ran down your back.”

“Ew! Get it off!” you screeched, swatting at your back. “Peter, is it gone?” He just continued to stare at you. “Peter, help me get it off!” His facade cracked, and Peter dissolved into a fit of giggles. You narrowed your eyes at him and scoffed. “There’s no spider, isn’t there?”

“Sorry, I just had to get you.” He held out a hand, expecting you to hand over the s’more. You shook your head.

“Oh, no. No, no, no, no. After that? Nope, no treat for you.” Much to Peter’s horror, you tossed the s’more into the fire.

“What did it do to you? It was too young to die!”

“See what happens? You’ve made me waste a perfectly good s’more,” you teased, placing your hands on your hips. Ned rolled his eyes at the two of you.

“You guys fight like an old couple.” Your face went red again, and you avoided Peter’s gaze, taking a seat in the grass. Too bad you missed that Peter was blushing too.

He sat down next to you, and neither of you spoke for several minutes. You just watched the fire slowly die down. Your classmates were trickling back to their tents, leaving just a handful by the fire. Most of them were engrossed in their own conversations. You glanced over at Peter. He was looking up at the sky, deep in thought. As you started to turn back to the fire, you noticed a small creature inching its way up his pant leg. “Peter,” you hissed. He hummed and tilted his head to the side, giving you a lopsided grin. “There’s a big ass centipede on your leg.” He snorted.

“Using my trick against me? You’ll have to try harder than that, Y/N.”

“I’m serious.”

“Then get it off.”

“I’m not touching it!” Peter eyed you carefully. You seemed both horrified and concerned. He decided to play into your little game, looking down at his leg. His jaw dropped when he saw that you weren’t trying to trick him and that there was actually a massive centipede crawling towards his stomach.

The boy screamed and leapt to his feet. He swatted at the tiny beast while jumping up and down. Everyone’s attention turned to him. Some tried to conceal their laughter, while others blatantly laughed at him. Peter spun around, looking everywhere to make sure there weren’t any more bugs on himself. “Is there a little girl lost somewhere, or was that just Parker screaming?” Flash sniggered. Peter froze, realizing that everyone was staring at him. His face turned as red as a tomato, and he tried to hide behind his hands. You stood up, staring down Flash.

“Shut up! You’d react the same way.” Flash scoffed and crossed his arms.

“Nuh-uh. I’m a man. I’m not scared of a little bug.” You quickly scanned the ground before finding your target. You grimaced, but it was the only way to avenge Peter’s honor. Picking up the centipede, you flung it at Flash. He screamed just as loud as Peter. “What is wrong with you?” he screeched before retreating to his tent. You heard Peter laugh and smiled. He looked slightly less embarrassed.

“Thanks, Y/N. I owe you one.”

“No problem, Pete. But I was a little disappointed that Flash didn’t piss his pants like I was expecting him to.” Peter snorted, shaking his head. He opened his mouth then closed it. You watched him expectantly. After a few moments, he finally spoke.

“So, I was wondering— uh— when we get back to the city, do you wanna hang out sometime? Like, just us?” he squeaked. Your smile widened.

“I’d love to.” Peter’s face lit up, almost as if he didn’t believe you would agree. Then, there was a voice in the distance. Not just any voice, it was Ned’s.

“It’s about time! MJ, told you he would ask them out before the end of the trip. You owe me five bucks!”

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive of Our Own under the tag Peter Parker. The stories are automatically posted here from the RSS feed.

summary: The world isn’t going to end
title: The world isn’t going to end
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Fu3JRW

by Confused_duckling

Peter was broken, he knew that. He also knew that nothing would be able to fix him.

Natasha disagreed.
